definition: variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women
pinyin: Xiao1 chu2 dui4 Fu4 nu:3 Yi1 qie4 Xing2 shi4 Qi2 shi4 Gong1 yue1
containing_words.word: 消除对妇女一切形式歧视公约

sentences.english: The greed, discrimination and vulgarism are not souls.
sentences.chinese: 贪婪，歧视和庸俗没有灵魂。

sentences.english: But what if gender discrimination is in fact happening?
sentences.chinese: 但要是真的有性别歧视存在又会怎么样呢？

sentences.english: The law does not discriminate against the poor in favour of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 法律绝不歧视穷人而偏袒富人。

sentences.english: Don't stir up area discrimination, or it'll trigger many disharmonious sounds.
sentences.chinese: 不要搞出地域歧视来，否则会激起很多不和谐的声音。

sentences.english: Even so, Kaifeng Jews say they weren't singled out for discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，开封犹太人说他们并没有遭到歧视对待。

sentences.english: He sponsored legislation in Illinois that would ban discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation.
sentences.chinese: 在伊州，他资助了一项禁止性取向歧视的立法。

sentences.english: Criminalization and discrimination foster new infections each day.
sentences.chinese: 刑事定罪和歧视每天都在促发新的感染。

sentences.english: I felt like a rube but nobody discriminated me.
sentences.chinese: 觉得自己像个乡巴佬进城，却没人歧视我。

sentences.english: Ravi lost his mother at the age of 16 months as a result of prejudice and negligence.
sentences.chinese: 因为歧视和疏忽，拉菲在十六个月大的时侯丧母。

sentences.english: You should not discriminate against minorities.
sentences.chinese: 你们不应歧视少数民族。
甚至连种族歧视现在也是自反性的。

sentences.english: She served as president for 14 years leading campaigns against segregation and discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 她担任主席14年，领导了多次反隔离反歧视运动。

sentences.english: Any law that discriminates agai t gays could be ripe for reversal.
sentences.chinese: 任何歧视同性恋的法律均有可能快被推翻。

sentences.english: There are some people discriminating the childern born after 1990s to make small to big purposely.
sentences.chinese: 是有些人对90后有歧视，故意大做文章吧？

definition: discrimination (against sb)/also written 歧視|歧视
to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
